item.title: The better way to count(*)
item.description: The better way to count(*) Have you ever wanted to know the size of a table? Typically, if you’re worried about how big it is, it’s already huge. Why not just SELECT count(*) from huge_table? That may not be the best idea, especially if your table is larger than a few hundred thousand rows. Let’s explore why that is the case in MySQL specifically. TLDR Use ANALYZE TABLE table_name; SELECT table_rows FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.
